🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

Did you know there are different kinds of floods? Flash floods, river floods, coastal floods, and urban floods. All of these floods have one big thing in common: there's a lot of water where there usually isn't any. This can happen quickly or slowly, depending on the type of flood. 

In this video, we'll learn about these different kinds of floods and what causes them. When a flood happens, it can bring about a lot of changes. Mostly bad, but would you believe there are some positive things that can come out of a flood, too? We'll talk about it. We'll also talk about how you can be prepared in case of a flood, to stay safe.

videos.description:

This playlist will focus on Earth Science and natural phenomena, including hurricanes, tsunamis, floods, avalanches, earthquakes, tornadoes, and more!  𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!

🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

An avalanche is like a flood made of snow! Or...like a blanket of snow sliding quickly down a mountain. OR...like a snowball rolling down a hill, getting bigger and bigger as it goes. Did you know there are different kinds of avalanches?

In this video, we talk about several different kinds of avalanches: slab avalanches, wet avalanches, and loose slow avalanches. We also learn about where avalanches are more likely to happen, and what causes them—both in the short-term, but also what are some underlying circumstances that make avalanches take place. 

There are steps you can take to avoid being caught in avalanches, but just in case it happens, we also talk about how to make it more likely you will survive and be found by search and rescue teams. Finally, we take a peek at some of the steps people are taking to prevent avalanches from happening in the first place.

videos.description:
𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝙉𝘼𝙏𝙐𝙍𝘼𝙇 𝙒𝙊𝙉𝘿𝙀𝙍𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids

🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

Mountains are pretty solid, right? "Solid as a rock!" But actually, bits of them fall off, slide off, and tumble down all the time. These are LANDSLIDES. 
Did you know there are different kinds of landslides? Slides, flows, falls, and topples. You'll learn how to tell them apart in this video! 

What causes landslides? Sometimes it's completely natural, but this is one of those acts of nature that people sometimes influence (especially by deforestation). There's one BIG reason that you might be forgetting: GRAVITY!

We'll also discuss how you might tell a landslide is coming, and steps that people can take to prevent them.

videos.description:
𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝙉𝘼𝙏𝙐𝙍𝘼𝙇 𝙒𝙊𝙉𝘿𝙀𝙍𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids

🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

We think of the Earth as SOLID, right? Solid as a rock! Except sometimes, the Earth shakes and rumbles under our feet. EARTHQUAKES happen when tectonic plates move against each other. You can picture tectonic plates like gigantic puzzle pieces that make up all of the Earth's crust. 
In this video we'll talk about some of the causes of Earthquakes, and how scientists study them using special tools like seismographs. We'll learn how to describe the size of earthquakes using the Richter scale and the moment magnitude scale. And finally, we'll talk about the ways architects design buildings to keep us safe (and steps we can take to keep ourselves safe) in the event of an earthquake.

videos.description:
𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝙉𝘼𝙏𝙐𝙍𝘼𝙇 𝙒𝙊𝙉𝘿𝙀𝙍𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids

🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

When we were kids, we heard about quicksand so much that we really thought we were going to get trapped in it at any moment! But somehow we escaped that fate. Today, let's learn about what quicksand actually is (not a type of sand!) and how to get out if you ever actually see some and fall in. 
It's a lot harder to get out of tar pits, as evidenced by the many fossils found in them. Have you ever been to the La Brea Tar Pits or another tar pit? We'll take a look at how they are formed and why it was so hard for the prehistoric animals to escape them. Lucky for us, that means we can find their fossils. 

Speaking of prehistoric animals:

Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

Thunder is loud and scary. But it can't really hurt you. Lightning on the other hand, is genuinely dangerous! And you get both thunder and lightning in THUNDERSTORMS. 

Today we'll talk about how thunderstorms happen. First, we'll look at the special clouds involved: CUMULONIMBUS clouds. Next we'll think about what happens inside the clouds that leads to electricity building up and eventually discharging in the form of lightning. 
Did you know there are different kinds of lightning? We will talk about the several kinds that can happen during thunderstorms, including cloud to cloud lightning, and cloud to ground lightning. There are more. We'll save ball lightning for another video!

Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

We love a good fire in the fireplace! Or sitting around a cozy campfire. Fire can bring warmth and comfort, when it's under control. But sometimes fire goes wild, and burns down a lot of trees, brush, and even homes. 

In this video, we'll talk about different types of wildfires (like crown fires and ground fires), and different things that can cause wildfires, some natural, some due to people being careless. Did you know one common natural cause of wildfires is lightning? 
If you haven't seen it yet, jump over to our Thunderstorm video: 
⛈️ https://youtu.be/OqgT24uPcGc

We'll also talk about the basic questions like what is fire, actually? And what is smoke?

3:34 Wildfire Chemistry
4:56 Types of wildfires
6:33 Recovery from wildfires
7:32 Firefighters
8:46 Staying Safe & preventing wildfires

🎨 https://shop.socratica.org - check this site regularly
Perfect for classrooms and home study rooms. You'll look at it and laugh, and then remember what it says. 

Tornadoes aren't just found in movies like Twister (and Twisters) and the Wizard of Oz. They're a real natural phenomenon with enormous power. In this video we'll learn what causes tornadoes, and what situations make them more likely to occur. This has to do with geography (places like "Tornado Alley" are more likely to have tornadoes) but also just the right weather conditions.

Not all tornadoes are the same, and we'll learn about supercell and non-supercell tornadoes. Then there's a variety of intensities—meteorologists (weather scientists) use the Fujita scale so we all know just how big of a tornado we're talking about. 

Did you hear the term "mesocyclone?" You'll come across this term again in our video about thunderstorms. Learn More:
⛈️Thunderstorms  https://youtu.be/OqgT24uPcGc

videos.title: What is a BIOME? Nature's neighborhoods! 🌎 Ecology & Environment
videos.description:
𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝘽𝙄𝙊𝙈𝙀𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids
This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 distinct "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!

Where do you call home? That is, where would Mother Nature say you live? When we're talking about nature and ecology, it doesn't matter what city, state,  or country you live in. We're talking about BIOMES, which are like nature's neighborhoods. 
There are 5 or 11 different biomes, depending on who you ask. The basic 5 are Aquatic, Desert, Forest, Grassland, and Tundra. These can be further split up into 11! Each of these biomes are home to distinct plants and animals (flora and fauna) that are well adapted for the specific sort of climate found in that biome. 
So for instance, the desert is known for having very little rainfall, and most deserts get pretty hot. So the plants and animals that live there have evolved to have adaptations well-suited for that set of living conditions. The plants don't have big broad leaves that would wilt in the sun. Instead they have spikes or spines, like cacti. The animals tend to be small, and are more active at night, when it's cooler, and often have big ears to cool off. Compare that with animals that live in the cold, where they are more likely to be bigger but have little ears, and layers of blubber for insulation to stay warm. 

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. We are planning a follow-up series that goes into greater depth about the animals in each biome. If you'd like to help us make those videos, you can support our work here:

videos.title: Explore the ARCTIC TUNDRA biome ❄️ Nature Ecology & Environment
videos.description:
𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝘽𝙄𝙊𝙈𝙀𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids
This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 distinct "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

Life in the Arctic Tundra is EXTREME. Extremely northern, extremely cold, extremely dry. Would you choose to live here? 
The Arctic Tundra is home to some very specialized plants and animals that are well adapted to live in this unusual environment. In this video, we'll explore this biome and get a better understanding of what the natives like polar bears, caribou, and arctic foxes have to deal with. 

Want to learn more about reindeer/ caribou? Watch:
https://youtu.be/UXsqn8cskZ8

Did you know the Arctic Tundra isn't the only Tundra in the world? There's also the Antarctic Tundra (at the South Pole), and the Alpine Tundras (at very high altitudes, like in the Alps). Make sure you're subscribed so you don't miss those videos! 
http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. We are planning a follow-up series that goes into greater depth about the animals in each biome. If you'd like to help us make those videos, you can support our work here:

What is life like at the highest altitudes, way up in the tallest mountains? That's what ecologists are trying to find out when they study the ARCTIC TUNDRA BIOME. This is a cold, dry place (although sometimes there's snow). Only plants and animals with very special adaptations can survive here in these harsh conditions. In this video we'll learn more about this unique place, including the climate and meeting a few of the native flora and fauna (that's ecologist speak for plants and animals).

This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 distinct "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. 💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

When you hear grasslands, you might be thinking it's a place like a lawn at your house or the park. But Tropical Grasslands is a phrase that ecologists use to describe a very specific biome. This is a place close to the equator, that stays comfortably warm all year long, and supports a wide variety of different plants and animals (flora and fauna). Including GRASS! 
If you think about going on Safari to see animals like Lions, Giraffes, Wildebeest, etc. you'll have a good idea what Tropical Grasslands (also known as the savanna) is like. Let's find out more!

videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝘽𝙄𝙊𝙈𝙀𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids
This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 different "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. We are planning a follow-up series that goes into greater depth about the animals in each biome. If you'd like to help us make those videos, you can support our work here:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

The Temperate Forest is one of the eleven biomes on Planet Earth. The word "Temperate" lets you know that this is not a place of extremes, but rather sort of average! There are four seasons, but still it never gets TOO hot or TOO cold. That's partly because there is fairly consistent precipitation, and the water vapor in the air helps maintain the even temperature. Compare that with the desert, where the temps can swing wildly from burning hot to freezing cold in the same day. 
In this video, we'll look at the characteristic plants of the Temperate Forest Biome - it should come as no surprise that trees are involved in a forest, but you may not know that it's especially the trees that change color in autumn that can be found here. We also meet some of the animals that call this biome home.

0:52 What is a Biome?
1:34 The Four Seasons
3:51 Precipitation in the Temperate Forest
4:43 Types of Temperate Forest
6:19 What are the Plants like?
8:01 What are the Animals like?

This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 distinct "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. 💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

When you think of the desert, maybe you think of hot sand, camels, lizards, and cacti. But did you know you can also have a COLD desert, with ice sheets, lichen, and penguins? Antarctica is also considered a desert! It's because what makes a desert isn't the heat, but the lack of precipitation. So we have a variety of different deserts around the world—some hot, some cold, but all of them are very dry. 
In this video, we'll look at the desert biome and the plants and animals that call it home.

This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 distinct "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!

The Earth looks like a "pale blue dot" from space, there's so much water! Over 70% of the Earth is covered with saltwater, but there's another 1% that is FRESHWATER. Thank goodness, because we need that fresh water to live! We can't drink the salty variety. 
In this video we'll talk about the Freshwater Biome, and that means we'll discuss not just the water, but also the climate and the plants and animals that call this biome home.

This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 different "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. 💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

We hear a lot about life at the North Pole. Polar Bears, reindeer, and the big guy himself, SANTA. But what about the South Pole? Who lives there? 
The icy, frozen land at the south pole is a special biome known as the Antarctic Tundra, and it's home to some unusually adapted plants and animals that can survive the harsh conditions. It's the coldest place on Earth, and it's also one of the driest. That's right - it gets so little precipitation, it's technically a desert!
In this video, we'll learn more about the climate, the times of year when it's all sun or no sun, and the special plants and animals that live there. There are some special people who live there too - research scientists!

9:19 Research

𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝘽𝙄𝙊𝙈𝙀𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids
This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 different "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. We are planning a follow-up series that goes into greater depth about the animals in each biome. If you'd like to help us make those videos, you can support our work here:

💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You might know this area as the Rainforest, but ecologists call it the Tropical Forest Biome. A biome is not just a place, but also the climate, plants and animals that live there because they are well-suited for life in those conditions. In the case of the Tropical Forest biome, it's always warm, because in the tropics (areas close to the equator), the amount of sunshine throughout the year is fairly constant. There's also abundant rainfall. This means a lot of plant life, which means in turn a lot of animal life! There's a huge diversity of flora and fauna in the Tropical Forest Biome.

videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

𝙉𝙀𝙒 𝘽𝙄𝙊𝙈𝙀𝙎 𝙨𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙨 🌎😎 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀! http://bit.ly/SocraticaKids
This nature and ecology playlist will focus on the 11 different "neighborhoods" on our planet—Biomes. They each have a distinct  climate, with plants and animals that are well-suited to live there. 𝙎𝙐𝘽𝙎𝘾𝙍𝙄𝘽𝙀 so you get to see each new video!
The first video in the series is here:
🌎 Biomes https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c

In this series, we'll look at the 11 different biomes that ecologists study. We'll discuss the specific climate, plants, and animals found in each biome. We are planning a follow-up series that goes into greater depth about the animals in each biome. If you'd like to help us make those videos, you can support our work here:

💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

If you eat cereal, bread or toast, corn, rice, or all sorts of other grains, you should know about the Temperate Grassland Biome, because that's where a lot of our food comes from! The whole center part of the United States is mostly this biome, and is nicknamed the "Country's Breadbasket." It's not just home to a lot of our agriculture. As a biome, it serves as the natural habitat for a variety of plant and animal life including wild grasses (hence the name), wildflowers, bison, rabbits, mice, prairie dogs, etc. 
Much of this kind of land has been developed for agricultural purposes, not just in the US but all around the world. In this video, we'll consider the changes that have been made, and if there's a way to get back to a more sustainable situation in this important biome.

videos.title: Animals of the Boreal Forest Biome 🌲 Wolf, Lynx, Moose, Hare, Owl...
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the conditions of the Boreal Forest Biome. These animals have both physical and behavioral adaptations to make this possible—can you find some of each?  These animals are able to deal with, for instance, a very short growing season for  plants. And then comes a long, cold winter. Could you survive in a place like this?

𝙅𝙪𝙢𝙥 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙥𝙞𝙘𝙨 𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙚:
0:00 Intro - Boreal Forest Animal adaptations

videos.title: Animals of the Tropical Grassland Biome 🦁 Lion, Elephant, Giraffe, Cheetah, Zebra...
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the specific conditions of the TROPICAL GRASSLAND, aka the Savanna Biome: fairly constant temperature, because this biome is found along the equator where there are similar hours of daylight all year long. But there is a distinct wet season and dry season. Animals who live here have to be specially adapted to handle both of these extremes. Could you do this?

videos.title: Animals of the Alpine Tundra Biome 🐐 Snow Leopard, Wolverine, Mountain Goat, Pika...
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the specific conditions of the ALPINE TUNDRA. This biome is found around the world, at the tops of mountains (think the Alps). This is a place that gets very cold for many months out of the year. Do you think you could survive there? What would you do to stay warm? We'll find out how animals use various strategies to thrive in this harsh environment. See how many adaptations (both physical and behavioral) you can find!

videos.title: Animals of the Temperate Forest Biome Bears, Deer, Fox, Hawk, Owl...
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the conditions of the Temperate Forest Biome. This is a place that has all four seasons: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter. It's almost like living in four separate environments. This means the animals who live here need to be adapted for many different conditions: cool, wet spring, warm summers, the autumn will falling leaves, and a cold winter with very little growing. Do you think you could survive outside during all these seasons? How do you think the animals do it?

videos.title: Animals of the Desert Biome🐪 Camel, Tortoise, Gila Monster, Fennec Fox...
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the conditions of the Desert Biome. Deserts are found all over the world, and what they have in common is very little rainfall. We also tend to think of deserts being hot places, but did you know there are cold deserts as well? If you'd like to learn more about that, check out our Desert Biome video next. 

In this video, we're focusing on the adaptations the animal residents of the desert have, that make them well-suited for life there. How do they get by in such a dry place? Do they have strategies for conserving water? Sometimes these adaptations are physical, sometimes, behavioral. See if you can notice the difference for each animal we talk about!

videos.title: Animals of the Antarctic Tundra Biome 🐧 Penguins, Seals, Orca
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the pretty extreme conditions of the Antarctic Tundra Biome. At first glance, it doesn't look like there's much life here in this frozen place that doesn't get a lot of sunlight for much of the year. But look closer, and you'll see many different kinds of penguins and seals, both of which spend some of their time on land, and some in the frigid waters. Once in the water, you'll find giants like orcas and blue whales, along with teeny tiny animals like krill. How do these animals handle the cold? We'll look at some of the special adaptations, both physical and behavioral, that allow a few special animals to thrive in this biome.

videos.description:
🌵𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

HAPPY Lunar New Year! Happy Year of the SNAKE! 
Do you know all the Chinese Zodiac animals?
You can learn more about them in our video: 
🐍Chinese Zodiac Animals
https://youtu.be/x_rxe4B67ns

🏮 How to Celebrate Lunar New Year

You've seen our series on Biomes🌎 
https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. Snakes are unusual in that they are adapted to do well in many different biomes. 

Of course, snakes are not all identical. Take a close look at the snakes in this video. They have special adaptations, both physical and behavioral, that make them well adapted to the environment they live in. 

In this video, we'll learn more about what snakes are like. What do they eat? Can they sense the world (seeing, hearing, etc) like we do? How do they move around since they have no legs?

videos.title: Animals of the Tropical Forest Biome 🐍 Jaguar, Anaconda, Capybara, Toucan
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You've seen our series on Biomes: 🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the specific conditions of the TROPICAL FOREST biome. This is sometimes called the Rainforest, because of the extremely high amount of rainfall. All that humidity means the temperature is fairly stable. So you don't see animals that are especially adapted to extreme temperature fluctuations. Rather, we find a variety of animals that have special adaptations that allow them to thrive at different levels of this moist forest. Some animals live way up in the trees. Others live down on the forest floor. Can you imagine how these would require different physical and behavioral traits?

videos.title: Animals of the Temperate Grassland Biome 🦊 Red Fox, Prairie Dog, Bison, Hares
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩:

🌽Temperate Grassland Biome https://youtu.be/llkPgycSkNg
In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the specific conditions of the Temperate Grassland Biome. The truth is, this is one of the easier places to live on our planet! It never gets too hot or too cold, and there is plenty of food and shelter. That doesn't mean that animals don't have special adaptations that make them well-suited for life in this biome. In fact, there are many animals who could NOT live here. Can you think of any?

videos.title: Animals of the Arctic Tundra Biome 🐇 Polar Bear, Narwhal, Walrus, Caribou
videos.description:
𝙎𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙤𝙧𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙣𝙤𝙣𝙥𝙧𝙤𝙛𝙞𝙩: 
💙  https://socratica.kindful.com

You've seen our series on Biomes: 
🌎 https://youtu.be/TCQUKmTgX4c
Now we're taking a deeper dive so you can #LearnMore with us! Let's meet the Animals that are specially adapted to live in each Biome. 

❄️ Arctic Tundra Biome
https://youtu.be/UzKKrqRtcow

In this video, we take a closer look at the animals that are able to live in the specific conditions of the ARCTIC TUNDRA. One common survival strategy involves changing coat colour with the seasons, for better camouflage. That's not so different from us changing into winter clothes! 

𝙅𝙪𝙢𝙥 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤𝙥𝙞𝙘𝙨 𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙚:
0:00 Intro to Arctic Tundra Biome Conditions
0:56 Polar Bear
2:28 Arctic Fox
3:25 Caribou aka Reindeer
4:28 Snowy Owl
5:29 Lemming
6:25 Biomes Course
6:56 Musk Ox
8:08 Arctic Hare
9:05 Ermine aka Stout
9:53 Walrus
10:46 Narwhal
11:36 Ptarmigan

🦌 Want to see more caribou/reindeer? 
https://youtu.be/UXsqn8cskZ8

Our videos are perfect for classroom and homeschool use, encouraging middle school kids to think deeply about their environment and the animals we share our planet with. Additional STEM educational activities are available on our website,  https://www.socratica.org

Want to take home a 𝙎𝙈𝘼𝙍𝙏+𝙁𝙐𝙉 souvenir?
👕 https://shop.socratica.org

🏔️ Avalanches https://youtu.be/7af1AoNLlY4
🌋Volcanic Eruptions https://youtu.be/icZUt-C2VKM
🌀 Hurricane, Typhoon, & Cyclone https://youtu.be/edSv8nK3aMI
🌊 TSUNAMIS https://youtu.be/vwkeXohc_N4
⚫ Black Holes https://youtu.be/RayH5j1VGS8
🦈 Sharks https://youtu.be/Roik25sdvuM

videos.description:
𝙅𝙊𝙄𝙉 𝙁𝙍𝙀𝙀  𝘼𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙙'𝙨 𝙅𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙣𝙖𝙡 𝘾𝙡𝙪𝙗
💌 https://snu.socratica.org/astridsjournal
Sign up to receive bonus activities, ideas for how to keep your own journal, and more! 

𝘽𝙇𝘼𝙉𝙆 𝙅𝙊𝙐𝙍𝙉𝘼𝙇
📘 https://shop.socratica.org/collections/astrids-journal
Get started on your own journey!  Proceeds benefit The Socratica Foundation, an educational nonprofit. 

𝙍𝙀𝘼𝘿𝙀𝙍'𝙎 𝙂𝙐𝙄𝘿𝙀 with enrichment educational activities 
🔗📃 LINK COMING SOON
(be sure to sign up so you can get notified when it is available for free download)

𝘼𝙎𝙏𝙍𝙄𝘿'𝙎 𝙅𝙊𝙐𝙍𝙉𝘼𝙇 - 𝙀𝙋𝙄𝙎𝙊𝘿𝙀 01 
Read along with our illustrated audiobook! 
🦋 Astrid Fischer is 10 years old, almost 11. She lives in Scandiland, where kids don't go to school but instead do real work in apprenticeships until they find what profession suits them. Astrid starts her journey in this episode. 

Astrid's Journal is an illustrated audiobook series perfect for fans of Harriet the Spy, Diary of a Wimpy Kid, and Ender's Game. In combination with the Reader's Guide Exercises, it is a robust introduction for students (grades 3-8) to the powerful techniques of journaling. 

Keeping a journal is one of the most appealing tools for developing writing skills. Journaling is also beneficial for emotional development, helping kids better understand the events in their lives, recognizing their responses, and how to deal with them constructively. 

💡 Looking for a way to help your child develop a lifelong writing habit? 💡
Journaling is a great way to encourage self-expression, build writing skills, and develop emotional intelligence. In this video, we introduce journaling in a kid-friendly way that makes it easy to get started! Whether your child is new to journaling or already loves writing, this introduction offers practical tips and creative ideas to help them find their voice. 
Watch our Introduction to Journal Writing for kids: 
✍️ https://youtu.be/_NvWo2lUwdU

𝙉𝙊𝙏𝙀 𝙁𝙊𝙍 𝙄𝙉𝙎𝙏𝙍𝙐𝘾𝙏𝙊𝙍𝙎
The focus of each episode of Astrid's Journal is to help students build strong foundational skills, meeting the Reading Standards for the Common Core for English Language Arts (Literature and Writing) for grades 3-5. Please see the attached PDF "Reader's Guide" that includes a variety of enrichment activities to extend the learning experience for the above mentioned areas, as well as writing exercises. Students will get experience reflecting on what they have read, as well as producing their own work through a series of journaling prompts for each episode. Note the interdisciplinary nature of the exercises, including history, geography, and math as well as language arts. 

Focus Domains:
Reading Foundational Skills
Reading Literature
Speaking and Listening
Writing

videos.title: Intro to Journal Writing for Kids (ELA) 🦋 Astrid's Journal Preface
videos.description:
𝙅𝙊𝙄𝙉 𝙁𝙍𝙀𝙀  𝘼𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙙'𝙨 𝙅𝙤𝙪𝙧𝙣𝙖𝙡 𝘾𝙡𝙪𝙗
💌 https://snu.socratica.org/astridsjournal
Sign up to receive bonus activities, ideas for how to keep your own journal, and more! 

𝘽𝙇𝘼𝙉𝙆 𝙅𝙊𝙐𝙍𝙉𝘼𝙇
📘 https://shop.socratica.org/collections/astrids-journal
Get started on your own journey!  Proceeds benefit The Socratica Foundation, an educational nonprofit. 

💡 Looking for a way to help your child develop a lifelong writing habit? 💡

Journaling is a great way to encourage self-expression, build writing skills, and develop emotional intelligence. In this video, we introduce journaling in a kid-friendly way that makes it easy to get started!

Whether your child is new to journaling or already loves writing, this introduction offers practical tips and creative ideas to help them find their voice. Plus, they’ll get a sneak peek into Astrid’s Journal, our illustrated audiobook series designed to inspire young writers.

🦋 This preface to Astrid's Journal serves as an introduction to journaling, especially for learners in grades 3-5 English Language Arts (ELA); but this is a practice accessible to a wide age range. Topics discussed in this video include the benefits of journaling for developing writing skills, as well as emotional intelligence. A few themes for journals are suggested, as well as the idea of more specific Journal Writing Prompts. Reading other journals is introduced, including those that are historical, as well as works of fiction. Two that we recommend are:

The Diary of a Young Girl, by Anne Frank
 📘 https://amzn.to/4iLZlyq

Harriet the Spy, by Louise Fitzhugh
  📘  https://amzn.to/3XAQoiR

Included in this video is a preview of our new Illustrated Audiobook series, "Astrid's Journal." Participating in this series is a truly interactive way to get kids reading, listening, and writing.  Read on for a description of the first episode!
